title: Format in TB
content:
Sometimes when I copy & past part of an article, et,c it changes some of the format settings for TB email. I've been unable to change text style back to the original setting of the email. What I pasted will have ended in a footnote in superscript and I can't change the text style back to no specific text style or any other text style. IIf i click on discontinue text styles (in Format menu) if I try to continue typing email message it'll still be in superscript. This has happened multiple times. I can skip to the next line, doesn't matter, superscript will still be the text style, not the original text style of the email. 

How do I return the text style to the original settings?
creator: azure7

title: Change defult search shortcut from "CTRL + SHIFT + K"
content:
Hello I am new to Thunderbird I am an Outlook user

Is there a way to set up the same shortcuts in Thunderbird as in Outlook?

For example I would love to set "CTRL + E" to place a cursor on the search bar, just like in Outlook. I searched all over the internet and ChatGPT and cannot find how to do it. Is it possible to override the default shortcuts Thank you in Advance Gary

title: Move emails from a POP email account to an IMAP account
content:
Hi,

I set up my email accounts using POP3. I now realize I should have set them up using IMAP. Since I originally set things up using POP3, all my emails have been downloaded to my computer, and have been deleted from my provider's server. I have now created a new email account using IMAP. Is there a way to import the emails from the POP3 Thunderbird folder, into my newly created IMAP folder?
creator: jlmackelvie

creator: tommy61

title: TB starts on wrong monitor
content:
I use 128.7.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 23H2. OS Name Microsoft Windows 11 Home Version 10.0.22631 Build 22631 I use two monitors: Monitor 1 is physically straight in front of me, and Monitor 2 is to the left, so in Settings > System > Display the box on the right is numbered 1, and the box on the left is numbered 2.

Since the latest TB update, each time I switch on the PC in the morning, TB (and FF) open on Monitor 2, even though I closed them down on Monitor 1 the previous night. This behaviour used to happen occasionally, now it seems to happen every time. Also, occasionally during the day, the TB Reminders window will jump to Monitor 2 while it's minimised.

I suppose the first question is - is this a TB/FF problem or a Windows problem? I'm thinking it must be a TB/FF problem, because this behaviour only seems to be happening with them.

Any suggestions would be welcome.
creator: bxcfilm
